org.jvoicexml.documentserver
Class VariableEncoder

java.lang.Object
  org.jvoicexml.documentserver.VariableEncoder

public final class VariableEncoder
extends Object

Convinient class to access variables from a given URI or add variables to it to send them back to the DocumentServer.

Variables are appended to the given URI like the query string in a URL.

Version:
$Revision: 190 $
Author:
Dirk Schnelle
See Also:
JVoiceXmlDocumentServer,

Copyright © 2005-2007 JVoiceXML group - http://jvoicexml.sourceforge.net/

Method Detail

getVariables

public Map<String,String> getVariables()
Get the currently defined variables and their values.

Returns:
Map of variable names and their values.

add

public void add(String name,
                String value)
Add a variable with the given name and value.

Parameters:
name - Name of the new variable.
value - Value of the variable.

toUri

public URI toUri()
Get an encoded uri, consisting of the base uri, and assigned variables. Use getBaseUri() to retrieve the uri without any variables.

Returns:
URI with variables.
See Also:
getBaseUri()

getBaseUri

public URI getBaseUri()
Get the base uri without any parameters. Use toUri() to retrieve the uri with assigned variables.

Returns:
Base URI without variables.
See Also:
toUri()
